title: Galen Sheely
text:
Hello,
I am a Ph.D.Â Candidate in the Department of Politics studying American politics at who the University of Virginia. My dissertation research is supervised by Justin H. Kirkland and focuses on the causes and consequence of state election legislation. Prior to studying at UVA, I earned a B.A. in politics with a minor in philosophy from the University of Washington.
My broader research interests include legislative behavior, race and ethnic politics, and research methods. I also work on state and nation-wide polling projects associated with the Karsh Institute of Democracy and the Virginia Department of Elections regarding voting experiences and perceptions of democratic legitimacy.

title: Publications and Projects
text: Elections 2021: Democracy, Voter Confidence, and Electoral Integrity in Virginia. Paul Freedman, Jennifer L. Lawless, and Galen Sheely. 2022, UVA Karsh Institute of Democracy.

title: Publications and Projects
text:
Working Projects:

Moving the Electoral Goalposts: State Legislative Strategies of Electoral Manipulation

Presented at Annual Midwest Political Science Association Conference 2023

Getting Blogged Down: Tracing Illiberal Political thought Through Blogs Using Text Analysis

Presented at Annual Midwest Political Science Association Conference 2023, to be presented at American Political Science Association Annual Meeting 2023.

State Electoral Entrepreneurs: Motivated Election Administration

To be presented at American Political Science Association Annual Meeting 2023.
